intro: Aloiampelos, commonly known as the rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees with dense, often spiny foliage. The leaves are typically thick and leathery, adapted to withstand arid conditions. The flowers are small and usually yellow or greenish-yellow, clustered in inflorescences. Aloiampelos plants are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in rocky or sandy soils.
